Walleys Landfill is served with an enforcement notice by @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyMids How can @RedIndustries2 resolve the mismanagement of the site by the 30/04/21 if they don‚Äôt recognise they have a problem? #deluded The health concerns grow @PHE_uk #stopthestink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/ZgVHPhVEbE

tweets.text: I pay tribute to our skilled teams and partners who worked so hard to achieve this - it‚Äôs not easy to bring major infrastructure projects in on time and on budget. The @EnvAgency 6 year programme has done just that, better protecting 300,000 homes against the misery of flooding. https://t.co/uymy11u20C

Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.

urls.title: Don‚Äôt dump it ‚Äì sort it!

tweets.text:
Are you doing the right thing with building site waste? Waste criminals often take this waste and dump it illegally.

You're responsible for your waste even if you pass it to someone else. Follow these 4 simple steps to protect yourself from #WasteCrime:
https://t.co/ReD1Pr8Zi5 https://t.co/CxKPluz6cG

This week our teams are out starting another yearly programme of routine maintenance on our main river and coastal defences.

tweets.text: Stone mini dams being installed within the Backstone Beck catchment of Ilkley Moor. This is to try and slow the flow of water into Ilkley. Working in partnership with @Bradford_CROW @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE #naturalfloodmanagement #nfm #naturalprocesses #moorland https://t.co/Rp6aEDOtbM

For more info - https://t.co/afaJ7T4ern https://t.co/YoDi85qxJe

@remrafagain @cpvolgroup @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW We've done quite well at our other sites, they've managed to avoid being eaten on the whole (apart from the odd one taken by Canada Geese) so hopefully this site will be the same. safe. #TeamEA https://t.co/FPTB8XjkE6 https://t.co/YxlvBzga6w

This shocking picture is a yard filled with illegally dumped construction and demolition waste. #WasteCrime harms our environment and economy. Make sure you dispose of construction waste legally, or risk being fined up to ¬£50,000 or face jail.

For those concerned about the risk to the chalk aquifer  caused by HS2 tunnelling we need access to see the details the environmental approval application lodged with the @EnvAgency recently. The contact email would be enquiries@environment-agency.gov.uk.

We‚Äôre counting down the days to the reopening of the riverside path alongside the River Lune.

The path has been closed since last Feb due to the building of new flood defences. https://t.co/SZM2uM5dLu
